fields.Title of Presentation: Quit Trying to Build a Better Mousetrap to Stop Cheating: Create Assessments that Use Technology instead of Fighting Against it
fields.Description/Abstract:
With the implicit understanding that students will use the book (even if we tell them not to) and that they can use a search engine to find any and all sorts of factual information, we have developed an entirely different way of going about the problem of assessment and “cheating.”  Rather than trying to “catch” students with increasingly complicated technology, we present instead an alternative vision for considering online course assessments.  

Our presentation will invite participants to think differently about the goals and objectives of class assessments of all types, offer examples of assessments we have developed specifically for online classes, and then provide opportunities for discussion and development of assessment questions for a variety of subject matters where it doesn’t matter if students use the book… because the answer the assessment seeks isn’t there.
